text:
The girl stumbled, then collapsed onto the seat. 

Raskolnikov watched her. 

She looked young, maybe fifteen. 

Her pretty face was flushed and heavy. 

“Are you alright?” he asked, stepping closer. 

She didn’t respond. 

Raskolnikov felt uneasy. 

A man stood nearby, watching them. 

He was plump, dressed sharply, and impatient. 

“Get away, that’s what I mean,” Raskolnikov shouted, clenching his fists. 

The man scowled. 

“How dare you, you low fellow!” 

He raised his cane. 

Raskolnikov stood firm, protecting the girl.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters a young, drunk girl on a deserted boulevard and feels compelled to protect her from a lurking gentleman with questionable intentions.
